net.silicontrip

Class UniformDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.silicontrip.UniformDistribution

  • public class UniformDistribution
extends java.lang.Object
    A uniform distribution statistics class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UniformDistribution

        public UniformDistribution(int a)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        a - the mid point of the distribution. Assumes a default range of +/- 0.5

      • UniformDistribution

        public UniformDistribution(int a,
                           double range)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        a - the mid point of the distribution.
        range - the value of the +/- from the midpoint.

      • UniformDistribution

        public UniformDistribution(double a,
                           double b)
        Constructor. This accepts arguments in any order and will sort upper and lower
        Parameters:
        a - a double value.
        b - a double value.

      • UniformDistribution

        public UniformDistribution(double a1,
                           double a2,
                           double b1,
                           double b2)
        Constructor. Accepts 4 values, picks the lowest and highest.
        Parameters:
        a1 - a double value
        a2 - a double value
        b1 - a double value
        b2 - double value

      • clampLower

        public void clampLower(double d)
        Sets a lowest cut off point for the lower bounds. if the lower bounds exceeds the cut off point it is set to the cut off point.
        Parameters:
        d - a double specifying the lower cut off point

      • mean

      • roundAboveZero

        public UniformDistribution roundAboveZero()
        get the rounded uniformdistribution value Fields cannot have a value of 0 so are rounded up to 1 This only works for positive UD
        Returns:
        Uniformdistribution rounded.

      • refine

        public boolean refine(UniformDistribution a)
               throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Performs an intersection with another Uniform Distribution and updates this one in place The idea is that improves the accuracy of the current UD
        Parameters:
        a - the UniformDistribution to refine this one with
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if this UD was improved
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if there was no overlap between the two UD

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        return a printable string, it's also a compatible JSON array.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the UD, could be used to reconstruct the UD.
